p.d: During an evening get-together, Paul has his fortune told by one of the guests. She tells him that he'll fall in love but also kill someone. And the two are linked. The first part comes true when he meets Camille. From then on, he tries to avoid the second prediction... Directed by: Manuel Schapira (France, 2016) Screenplay: Raphaël Chevenement, Manuel Schapira, Delphine de Vigan, based on the novella "Lord Arthur Savile's Crime" by Oscar Wilde Cast: Manu Payet (Paul), Laetitia Spigarelli (Hélene), Alma Jodorowsky (Camille), Blanche Gardin (Lucie), Claude Gensac (Josette Legourinec), Gilles Cohen (Richard), Olivier de Benoist (Bernard), Xavier Alcan (FX), le Comte de Bouderbala (the salesman) Genre: comedy Parental guidance: TV-PG
